remarks: A proper subspace of the span of a pair of vectors is the span of a singleton (an atom) or the zero subspace (if ` z ` is zero).  Proof suggested by Mario Carneiro, 28-Aug-2014.  (Contributed by NM, 29-Aug-2014.)
statement:
lspprat.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lspprat.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` W ) $.
lspprat.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` W ) $.
lspprat.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lspprat.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. S ) $.
lspprat.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
lspprat.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. V ) $.
lspprat.p $e |- ( ph -> U C. ( N ` { X , Y } ) ) $.
lspprat $p |- ( ph -> E. z e. V U = ( N ` { z } ) ) $.
$d N z $.
$d U z $.
$d V z $.
$d W z $.
$d ph z $.
